page.title: 06SOUTHWELL SINCE 1945
page.content: We asked our school secretary Mrs. Margaret Swan who has lived in Southwell all her life what has been the biggest change in Southwell since 1945.She said she thought it was the increase in the population. No new pubs have opened since 1945 but three pubs have closed down. The{Grapes,}The {Shoulder of Mutton}and The{Portland.} The schools that were in Southwell were the Minster Grammer,The National Church of England,The Methodist,The Rodney (PRIVATE) and Holy Trinity. The Minster Grammer,The Rodney (PRIVATE) and Holy Trinity are still in Southwell and in 1966 a new school called{LOWES WONG Infant and Junior {School}opened. No new roads have opened only the roads on the modern housing estates.
